# 11 Best Tools for Setting and Tracking Goals

Updated Mar 27, 2023

### Table of Contents

What are goal setting and tracking tools?What are the top goal setting and
tracking tools?What are the benefits of goal setting and tracking tools?

Sean Peek

Contributing Writer at business.com

Share this on FacebookShare this on twitterShare this on LinkedIn

Whether you’ve been in business for two months or 22 years, you probably have
goals for your company. These may be sales objectives, marketing initiatives
or cost-cutting measures. Maybe you want to increase employee engagement or
track retention. Perhaps you’re challenging team members to set quarterly
resolutions. Whatever the case, goal setting and tracking tools can hold you
and your staff accountable and measure your progress along the way.

## What are goal setting and tracking tools?

Goal setting and tracking tools are software businesses can use to establish
objectives, record progress, and understand how key performance indicators
(KPIs) help them achieve specific goals. Most goal setting and tracking tools
offer varied functionality, but they all hinge on setting SMART (specific,
measurable, attainable, realistic and timely) goals and establishing
objectives and key results (OKRs). A projected endpoint enables the tool to
mark and measure key points of progress.

TipBottom line

Align with your team on your overarching goals before tracking progress,
ensuring each person is on the same page from the start.

## **What are the top goal setting and tracking tools?**

As project management software has evolved over the last decade, so have tools
for goal setting and tracking. The best apps encourage productivity, foster
collaboration, and offer multiple pricing plans. **[Find more aspects to look
for in our** **project management software buying guide** **.]**

Here are 11 options to consider for your company.

### Asana

Asana offers handy tracking tools applicable to nearly every vertical of an
organization. It marries collaboration with goal tracking to keep your team
progressing. Among the platform’s 12 key tools, the “goals” feature enables
teams to set specific objectives and track their progress, with the ability to
input sub-goals and monitor team members’ contributions.

Asana offers four plans: Basic (which is free), Premium, Business and
Enterprise. The “goals” feature is only available in the Business
subscription, but both the Basic and Premium plans offer a task-tracking
feature that can double as a manual goal-tracking system for smaller teams.

### Trello

Trello is a Kanban-style web application with an emphasis on increasing
productivity. Kanban – characterized by lean lists and efficient, continuous
improvement – emerged in the 1950s from Toyota’s manufacturing arm. Now Trello
has brought list-making into the 21st century. Using the Kanban approach, your
team can use the platform to break larger goals into “mini-goals” that follow
a progression from “not started” to “completed” columns.

Thanks to Trello’s high customizability, teams in various industries can
benefit from its productivity tracking. It offers remote teams seamless
collaboration and integrations with hundreds of other helpful apps. It has
four pricing plans: Free, Standard, Premium and Enterprise.

### Engagedly

Engagedly is flexible performance management software that claims to increase
employee engagement by 90% after onboarding. Its E3 platform focuses on
performance execution, enabling professional development and driving employee
engagement. Businesses in industries such as consulting, professional
services, healthcare, nonprofit, education, government, technology and
financial services can all benefit from Engagedly’s interface. **[Related
article:** **How Professional Development Helps Your Small Business** **]**

The platform allows teams to take control of goal accomplishment strategies
and aligns objectives with business and department goals. With OKRs and
progress bars, Engagedly’s software helps you examine milestones, encourages
mentorship, and keeps historical data for goal-tracking success. For expert
performance and goal tracking, Engagedly’s starting annual agreement is
$5,000, with E3 pricing tiers for Practitioner, Leader, and Champion levels.

### Friday

Remote and hybrid teams looking for a modern all-in-one intranet solution
should consider Friday. It includes powerful features like engaging employee
directories, cross-channel searching, integrations with Slack and other tools,
and various customizations. With Friday’s goal-tracking functionality, you can
efficiently address common pain points like poor visibility and accessibility,
irregular progress, and workflow integration. The provider offers four pricing
tiers: Free, Individual, Team and Company. All levels except the free version
offer goal-tracking services. **[Learn more about Slack and other** **internal
communications apps** **that can aid your business.]**

### 15Five

15Five combines software with education and a supportive community for an
integrated ecosystem of performance management, development, and training.
Mostly used by leaders interested in human resources management, 15Five
enables businesses to build high-performing teams through continuous
performance management. **[Do you know the lingo? Here’s a glossary of**
**terms HR managers should know** **.]**

Depending on your company’s finances, a potential downside is that the
software does not offer a free plan. The Engage, Perform and Focus tiers
provide business goal-tracking capabilities for operations managers and
executives, while the Total Platform level satisfies the varied needs of whole
enterprises. 15Five’s robust insights keep teams aligned with their goals,
communicate OKRs clearly, and guide individual employees’ progress based on
their unique skill sets.

TipBottom line

Complement your goal-setting system with tools that measure employee
performance. You can use these tools similarly to set objectives and evaluate
progress over time.

### Jira

Designed for use by agile teams, Jira remains a top-rated software development
tool for issue tracking and management. Linked to Trello through parent
company Atlassian, Jira uses the Kanban approach and flexible planning to
enable value-driven prioritization of tasks and extensive reporting with
actionable results.

The Jira product line includes Jira Software, Jira Work Management, Jira
Service Management and Jira Align. For enterprises looking to align strategy
with outcomes, Jira Align promotes collaboration between business and
technology teams while optimizing customer value.

### Lattice

Lattice is an easy-to-use success platform that offers continuous performance
management capabilities for businesses. Specifically, Lattice Goals connects
individual achievements with OKRs for organizational success.

Lattice not only provides goal setting, tracking, and reporting functionality,
but it also integrates with popular platforms like Slack, Salesforce, and
Microsoft Teams to meet users where they already work. Lattice offers several
pricing options, allowing you to bundle various features for the system that
works best for your operations.

### Weekdone

Created with small businesses in mind, Weekdone’s OKR software helps small and
midsize businesses as well as startups establish a goal-oriented culture with
objectives, goal initiatives and hierarchies, OKR reports, and goal-based
coaching and onboarding.

Team and company leaders set the goals and general direction for employees,
who then develop specific objectives and key results to track and measure
their progress throughout a projected time frame. Weekdone even supports your
team with OKR coaches, helping you develop good habits and a successful, goal-
oriented company culture.

### Namely

While Namely also offers HR, payroll, benefits, and talent management, the
software’s goal setting and tracking functionality enables leaders of midsize
companies to give personalized attention to employees. You can set individual
employees’ goals, track their progress, link their objectives to higher-level
team goals and initiatives, and make notes in the software for future
reference.

### Databox

Databox offers a central dashboard with multiple tools and functions to track
performance. If your team relies on several software platforms to track
objectives, Databox stands out from other apps by enabling you to mix and
match metrics for a more complete picture of how your team performs against
its sales, marketing, and operations goals.

Databox’s Free Forever plan allows three data source connections, use of
standard features and more than 60 integrations. Paid plans (Starter,
Professional and Performer) include more connections, users, data boards and
frequent updates.

### Goalscape

For visual workers, Goalscape is powerful goal setting and tracking software.
Based on neuroscience, Goalscape lets you create a central goal and build a
dynamic graph of priorities that shade in as the goal approaches completion.
The easy-to-use software, which works for both personal and professional
endeavors, allows you to share your work with team members and comes with a
free 14-day trial.

Bottom LineBottom line

The right goal-tracking software for your company depends on your team’s
internal and external goals, the long-term cost, and how much you need to
scale or customize the platform.

## What are the benefits of goal setting and tracking tools?

Goal setting and tracking tools can have a profound impact on your business.
Follow our tips for setting better business goals, and the benefits are yours
to reap.

### Enhanced productivity

With clear goals in mind, teams have a path to follow, which boosts
productivity through meaningful work activities. Decreasing or eliminating
processes that don’t contribute to a specific goal enables each team member to
spend their time on tasks that serve the company’s larger vision. See our
small business productivity guide for more insights on increasing employee
performance.

### Increased team unity

Teams with a common goal are almost four times as likely to remain committed
to their company compared to those without a shared goal, according to BI
Worldwide. A central business objective – with measurable progress accessible
to each employee – motivates teams to work together to achieve the objective.
A positive byproduct is reduced employee turnover.

### Reduced confusion

Leaders who establish SMART goals with clear KPIs decrease confusion among
their staff about their job’s purpose, mission and daily responsibilities.
With specific, measurable, attainable, realistic, and timely goals, each team
member can conceptualize their role from the perspective of helping the
company progress toward the end objective.

Sean Peek

Contributing Writer at business.com

Sean Peek has written more than 100 B2B-focused articles on various subjects
including business technology, marketing and business finance. In addition to
researching trends, reviewing products and writing articles that help small
business owners, Sean runs a content marketing agency that creates high-
quality editorial content for both B2B and B2C businesses.
